architectural_decisions.title: Adopt Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security.

architectural_decisions.title: Use FastAPI for Building REST API
architectural_decisions.rationale: FastAPI offers high performance, easy-to-use API documentation, and robust features like dependency injection.

architectural_decisions.title: Implement Repository Pattern for Data Access Layer
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract data access and provide a clean interface for CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Employ Dependency Injection for Managing Dependencies
architectural_decisions.rationale: To facilitate modular code, testability, and maintainability.

architectural_decisions.title: Define Custom Exceptions Using FastAPI's HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle different error scenarios gracefully and return appropriate HTTP responses.

architectural_decisions.title: Support Multiple Payment Providers with PaymentProcessor Class
architectural_decisions.rationale: To offer flexibility and future-proof the payment processing functionality.

architectural_decisions.title: Enforce Authentication via JWT Tokens
architectural_decisions.rationale: For secure user identification and authorization.

architectural_decisions.title: Authorize Users Based on Their Role
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure proper access control and data privacy.

architectural_decisions.title: Utilize ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and promote code readability.

architectural_decisions.title: Send Confirmation Emails After Order Creation
architectural_decisions.rationale: To enhance user experience and provide order verification.

flows.description: The process involves creating, retrieving, listing, and cancelling orders through REST API endpoints.

steps.description: User creates a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Check if the order already exists based on the provided order ID.
Retrieve order details if the order exists; otherwise, create a new order.
Get order details using the order ID.
Check if the order was found using the order ID.
List all orders for the current user, supporting pagination.
Cancel a pending order using the order ID.
